epic.description: We need to upgrade mongoDB version to version 6.x (latest at the time of this writing) Potential areas of interests for upgrade: new features, security + performance gains, using latest version of our core technology  multi level transaction support  free cloud monitoring  change streams  schema validations  client-side field level encryption  mongodb connector for kafka  time series collection  stable API  cluster to cluster sync  sharded clusters mongodb Charts + Data lake -> Atlas Seems we will need to follow a successive update path: 3.2 → 3.4 → 3.6 → 4.0 → 4.2 → 4.4 → 5.0 → 6.0

issues.summary: Spring data compatibility issue fix
issues.description: After careful consideration of multiple versions of Spring Data MongoDB, the closest yet most compatible version found was 3.3.10. Following versions of Spring Data had been tried. 4.0.0 ❌ (Compilation Errors) 3.4.18 ❌  3.4.16 ❌ 3.4.15 ❌ 3.4.14 ❌ 3.4.9 ❌ 3.4.6 ❌ 3.4.5 ❌ 3.4.2 ❌ 3.4.1 ❌ 3.4.0 ❌ 3.3.10 ✅ After studying the changelog of releases between 3.3.10 and 3.4.15, nothing of concern has been identified. The version of Spring Data MongoDB being used in Vroozi’s SpringBoot projects is 3.3.4.

issues.summary: Evaluate instances within code where findOne should be replaced with findFirst
issues.description: Since the mongo driver has updated its core implementation , we need to identify the potential areas where findOne should be replaced with findFirst using the production data and spring data mongo repositories. GL Accounts and Cost Centers with same code and company Code are created with different names. Though this seems invalid data as from API documents these accounting elements can be searched by Code while creating e.g. purchase request and in this case the system used to pick anyone of the records based on the first found record. We need to put a validation so that this kind of data is not created. For now since the new driver gives error we can replace findOne with findFirst to mimic the system’s old behaviour. Multiple supplier task with  completed : false  data can be created in an edge case. In such a scenario the previous task should be marked completed before creating another. For now we can replace findOne with findFirst to mimic the system’s old behaviour. The issue can be produced against the following steps create PO (with price 200) Confirm PO from Supplier Portal Create POCR (price increase to 500) Dispute from Supplier Portal POCR again (set price to 300) Create ASN

issues.summary: PMAN: Invoice: Automate Accounting String Exception, when Invoice returns back from Exception Handling, after Goods Receipt has been created.
issues.description: Business Case : Currently, our system encounters a challenge when an Invoice returns from Exception Handling with an accounting string error after the Goods Receipt has been created. The system lacks a defined process for handling such accounting validation exceptions during this stage. Acceptance Criteria : What is the change?  If an accounting validation error is detected during the return of an Invoice from Exception Handling after the Goods Receipt has been created, the system should recognize this scenario and accordingly automate the Exception Handling process further. Which customers should this change impact?  All customers who have ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW = true and ACCOUNTING_STRING_VALIDATION = true. What pages should this change impact?  Invoices in Exception status. Which users should be impacted by the change?  AP Processor / AP Manager / Exception Handling group users. How should this change work? Detection of Accounting String Error : If an accounting validation error is detected during the return of an Invoice from Exception Handling after the Goods Receipt has been created, the system should recognize this scenario. Auto-Processing Rule Evaluation : The system should check the Auto-Processing rule configured for cXML and Supplier Portal invoices. Decision Making for Supplier Portal & cXML created Invoices : Based on the Auto-Processing rule, the system should determine whether the Invoice requires further attention by an Exception Handling group or can proceed to the next stage. Invoice created from Auto create invoices from Supplier Portal / cXML toggle GR Exception toggle Accounting String Error toggle Accounting String Error found? Decision Supplier Portal / cXML ON ON ON Yes GR is created and it resolves the Missing GR exception on the Invoice.  When moving to the next state, during Auto-processing, if the system finds  ANY  Accounting String Error,  Send Invoice to the User Group/Type selected for Accounting String Error for resolving the exception. The Assigned Exception Handler is allowed to resolve Accounting String Errors. The Assigned Exception Handler is able to return the Invoice back to AP. Supplier Portal / cXML ON ON ON No GR is created and it resolves the Missing GR exception on the Invoice.  When moving to the next state, during Auto-processing, if the system finds  NO  Accounting String Error, Follow current implementation. Supplier Portal / cXML ON ON OFF Yes GR is created and it resolves the Missing GR exception on the Invoice.  When moving to the next state, during Auto-processing, if the system finds  ANY  Accounting String Error,  Return Invoice back to AP and assign the Invoice Owner or AP Processor / Manager group depending on the Access rules. ( how it works currently in the system ) The AP user should see the Accounting string error. The AP user is allowed to send the Invoice for Exception handling in order to resolve the Accounting String Errors. Supplier Portal / cXML ON ON OFF No GR is created and it resolves the Missing GR exception on the Invoice.  When moving to the next state, during Auto-processing, if the system finds  NO  Accounting String Error, Follow current implementation. Decision Making for Invoices created manually by AP User : Invoice created from GR Exception Accounting String Error found? Decision Hopper or Manually by AP user. Yes Yes GR is created and it resolves the Missing GR exception on the Invoice.  When moving to the next state, during Auto-processing, if the system finds  ANY  Accounting String Error, Return Invoice back to AP and assign the Invoice Owner or AP Processor / Manager group depending on the Access rules. ( how it works currently in the system ) The AP user should see the Accounting string error. The AP user is allowed to send the Invoice for Exception handling for resolving the Accounting String Errors. Hopper or Manually by AP user. Yes No GR is created and it resolves the Missing GR exception on the Invoice.  When moving to the next state, during Auto-processing, if the system finds  NO  Accounting String Error, Follow current implementation. User Notification : Users involved in the Exception Handling group or Accounts Payable Processing should be appropriately notified. Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  Maybe. Would this change impact existing documents?  Maybe. To which teams should this change be communicated to?  N/A FYI -   /   /   /

issues.summary: PMAN: Invoice: USJ: Introduce a toggle for Auto Invoice Date Calculation, in the Supplier record, and automatically enable it for newly created Suppliers.
issues.description: Business Case : As an  Admin , I should be able to turn ON or OFF the Auto Invoice Date calculation settings in the Supplier record. Also, any new Supplier that gets created manually or through USJ / NBCU Interface should have this toggle ON by default. Acceptance Criteria : What is the Change?  Exposing the backend flag -  invoiceDateAutoCalculationEnabled  on to the Supplier record as toggle. What customers should this change impact on?  All customers who have ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW  = true  and  accountsPayableSettings.autoCalculationStrategies: ['SET_INVOICE_DATE_BASED_ON_MAX_DELIVERY_DATE'] New feature toggle introduction:  This should have been introduced as part of  . What pages should this change impact?  Master Data > Suppliers How should this change work? Expose the BE field -  invoiceDateAutoCalculationEnabled  by introducing a new toggle in the Master Data > Supplier > Supplier records. This toggle should only appear in the Supplier record if Invoice Date Auto Population Feature Toggle =  true . Toggle Name  - Allow Auto Invoice Date Calculation. Tooltip  - When this toggle is turned ON, the system will automatically calculate the Invoice dates on the Invoice for this supplier. When this Toggle is turned  ON  -  invoiceDateAutoCalculationEnabled  =  true . When this Toggle is turned  OFF  -  invoiceDateAutoCalculationEnabled  =  false . An Admin should be able to turn ON or OFF this toggle manually from the Supplier record. New Implementation  -  When a  NEW  Supplier record is created  Manually  in Purchase Manager or through the USJ / NBCU  Interface  (SAP / TIBCO), then the  Allow Auto Invoice Date Calculation toggle  should be  ON , by default. Note  - These are 4-5 vendors for whom this feature was disabled when this implementation was done in Phase 4. Please review this ticket for reference -    DO NOT update the Allow Auto Invoice Date Calculation setting for Suppliers that exist in the system today. If USJ wants to turn ON Allow Auto Invoice Date Calculation for old suppliers, then they can either do it manually or ask the SWAT Team to turn it ON via a script. New Implementation (mentioned above) will only work for newly created suppliers. Do we need a data-fix for existing customers?  No. Would this change impact existing customers?  Yes. (USJ) To which teams should change be communicated to?  Purchase Team and Integration Team. FYI -

issues.summary: PMAN: Invoice: Introduce new toggle for Enabling Coding & Apply to all functionality during Exception Handling.
issues.description: Business Case : As an  Admin , I should be able to decide whether Employee, Buyers, AP Coders and AP Managers should also be allowed to Code on Invoices during Exception Handling. Also, this toggle will allow these same users to use the Apply to All functionality during Exception Handling. Acceptance Criteria : What is the change?  Giving Admins the ability to choose whether they want their Requester, Buyer, AP Coder, and AP Manager to Code & use Apply to all on Invoices during Exception Handling. Which customers should this change impact?  All customers who have ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW = true. What pages should this change impact?  Accounts Payable > Settings > Exceptions page and Invoices in Exception Status. Which users should be impacted by the change?  Employee, Buyer, AP Coder and AP Manager. How should this change work? Introduce a  new Section  in Accounts Payable > Settings > Exceptions, in-between Tolerance Definitions and Exception Handler where these new toggles will be introduced. Heading  of the new Section -  Invoice Coding Access Under the Heading, the  Title  message would be - Allow certain user roles with Coding access and Apply to All functionality during Exception Handling. Add a  Note  below the Heading as -  Note : Please check the tooltip for more information . The  Tooltip  should be besides the Title message. Hovering over this Tooltip show display this message -  Turning this Toggle “ON” will allow Coding access to these users for a PO based Invoice during Exception Handling. Additionally, these users will also have access to the “Apply to All” functionality during Exception Handling . Requester. Buyer. AP Coder. Note :  AP Managers can always Code on Invoices during Exception Handling. Introduce a new toggle beside the Tittle. When this toggle is turned “ON” - codingForInvoicesInReconciliationEnabled = true. When this toggle is turned “OFF” - codingForInvoicesInReconciliationEnabled = false. Some Reference tickets  -       Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  No Would this change impact existing documents?  Yes To which teams should this change be communicated to?  None Questions: Question # AC # Raised By Inquiry Date Assignee Response Date             # Question Recommendation Response Remarks           Key Decisions: # Decision Point Decision Reasoning Validation Plan           FYI -   /

issues.summary: PMAN: Invoice: System triggers Accounting Validation when the invoice is loaded/refreshed when a document is in Pending status.
issues.description: Business Case : When an Invoice is in  Pending  status (waiting for invoice approval), then the system should re-trigger accounting validation when the Pending Invoice is loaded/refreshed. Acceptance Criteria : What is the change?  Re-trigger Accounting string validation when the Pending Invoice is loaded/refreshed. Incorrect accounting strings should be flagged and correct accounting strings should have the error message removed. Which customers should this change impact?  All customers who have ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW = true and ACCOUNTING_STRING_VALIDATION = true. What pages should this change impact?  Invoice in  Pending  status. Which users should be impacted by the change?  AP Approvers with  or  without AP Coder  or  Edit AP documents during approval role. How should this change work? Pre-Requisites: Conditions in AC #2 are fulfilled. AP Processor / Manager submits the Invoice for Approval to the AP Approver. If the Accounting information on the invoice becomes invalid after the Invoice has been submitted then - The system re-triggers accounting validation for all  incorrect accounting strings  when the AP Approver accesses the Invoice - for the  first time  or; refreshes  the Invoice page if it was already open  or; if they had  AP Coder  /  Edit AP documents during approval  role and tried to update the accounting information using the calculator / pencil ( this already works seems like )  or; when they click on  Approve  /  Approve and Forward  button . The system discards the accounting string errors pertaining to the ones that are deemed valid. The system continues to display the accounting string errors pertaining to the ones that are still invalid. Currently, in this ticket -  , we are not handling accounting validation on Invoices in Pending status proactively. That's something we need to  extend  to Pending status as well. Reference ticket -   where accounting validation was done for certain Invoice statuses. 6.  Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  No. 7.  Would this change impact existing documents?  No, as this functionality is not available in Production. 8.  To which teams should this change be communicated to?  All teams. Questions: Question # AC # Raised By Inquiry Date Assignee Response Date             # Question Recommendation Response Remarks           Key Decisions: # Decision Point Decision Reasoning Validation Plan  1. Should we allow the AP Approver to approve the Invoice without resolving the accounting string error?

issues.summary: PMAN: Web nodes fail after a limited number of restarts when a user logs in for a company that has enabled Supplier Portal but has no module settings.
issues.description: Precondition: Company has configured feature toggle SUPPLIER_PORTAL (collection  feature_toggles ) There is no module settings defined for module SUPPLIER_PORTAL (collection  module_settings ) Steps User from given company logs in Actual Result API call to retrieve module settings for module Supplier Portal Fails Additionally, the Node.js server fails ungracefully, which can lead to a complete shutdown of web nodes. Currently, the system allows for 100 restarts after a Node failure per each forever instance (currently there are 4 forever instances per each web node). Expected Result API call will still return 500 However, Node.js server gracefully handles the error, preventing restarts.

issues.summary: User bulk upload - System pick User Default incorrect If single cost centre is configured against multiple company codes
issues.description: Client - Please see attached email. To summarize, we have several users calling in from multiple locations reporting that their default company code and/or default shipping address are loading incorrectly on new purchases. We think it may be only an issue on Catalog purchases but not 100% sure about that. As an example, look at user Mauricio Martinez. His default company is set to C1-031 but on the attached Word doc you can see it is populating as H1-060. Additionally, his default shipping address is loading incorrectly. This is much more serious. With the company code being wrong it is not allowing them to move forward if they don't have access to that company. But with the ship-to wrong and users not aware and being used to this always loading as their default, I am worried this could result in numerous purchases company-wide being shipped to the wrong places causing us not only delays in getting what we need but also to incur significant monetary expenses to correct and re-ship everything where it needs to go ... so we to give this the highest priority and get it resolved as quickly as possible. Support Team: When was this user's profile updated last time ? I don’t believe I have updated it since it was created although I viewed it today. It seems like some changes have been made to users’ profiles maybe through imports or something backend as I see a lot of things have changed I don’t remember changing, specifically associated company codes being populated. Were there any Company Code restrictions added / removed from the user's profile? If yes, then which company code and when was this change made ? No changes that I am aware of, see answer above to  #1 . Which other users are having this issue so that we can compare their profiles and see what is common between them ? Chris Trahan, William Koenig, all users. The Shipping address in Mauricio's default setting and on the PR 1000127600 are the same. Is there an example where the wrong shipping address was selected ? That’s probably because he manually changed it. On new purchases it is defaulting incorrectly. Some users will be astute enough to change it, some will not. Can you provide more PR examples if possible where users are getting the Shipping Address or Company Code issue ? If more issue are reported I will forward. Please consider this issue has URGENT Priority . Development Team: this issue is occurred due to user bulk upload and this is System bug. According to the current implementation,  System get first cost centre from the DB using provided cost centre code in the file, System doesn't check its configured with provided company code or not. this issue only happened if single cost centre is configured against multiple company codes. As you can see in the screenshot, this was implemented in 2015.

issues.summary: Accounts Payable - Recalculate Tax on updating quantity and/or unit price via Item Inline Edit
issues.description: Goal As a user creating invoices, I want the tax to automatically recalculate when I inline edit item details, so that I can have accurate tax information without additional steps. Acceptance Criteria: When a user inline edits the price or quantity of an item on the Create Invoice screen, the tax amount for that item should automatically recalculate and display the updated value. A clear notification should be displayed to inform the user that the tax has been recalculated, ensuring visibility of the change. URL: https://purchase.vroozi.com Username:  asma.latif+APM@vroozi.com Password: Redangel1@ PreCondition: User should have logged into Application. Tax Code should be configured as taxable. Tax connector should be OFF. Steps: On Create Invoice Screen. Add an Item with price 100, qty 1 so the tax calculates as 10. Inline Edit item by changing price 200, qty 2. Please see tax is not recalculating. Edit Open the line item. And now change the price 300 , qty 3. Now the tax is recalculating as 30. Actual result: Tax is not recalculating in case of item Inline edit. Desired result: Tax should be recalculated. Show noty to inform user that tax was recalculated Test Data on Prod: 9000006695 Screen-Cast: https://www.screencast.com/t/gY0kXytt   Thanks, Asma

issues.summary: AccVal: The system should use Combo Objects to identify uniqueness while updating the accounting string via Bulk Upload.
issues.description: Business Case: The system should use the Accounting and Organization objects to check the uniqueness of the Accounting String via Bulk Upload. Acceptance Criteria: The system should determine the uniqueness of the accounting string by checking the unique combination of given accounting and organization objects. If the system finds the given combination in the DB, the system should update the existing accounting string. The validation checks should run as is for the rest of the columns. If the system does not find the given combination in the DB, the system should create a new accounting string. The given accounting and organization obects should be non-deleted and active.

issues.summary: AccVal: Admin: Admin can upload the accounting strings in CSV format via bulk upload file
issues.description: Business Case: As an admin, I want to be able to upload the accounting strings via bulk upload file in CSV format. So the system can use them for document validation for a file containing more than a million records. Acceptance Criteria: There should be a  Upload Accounting Strings  icon above the top right corner of the accounting string table on the Accounting String screen. ( The following image is just for reference. ) It should depend on a sub-feature toggle for UI CRUD operations(refer to  ). If the feature mentioned above toggle is ON, the user should be able to see the  Upload Accounting Strings  icon. If the feature mentioned above toggle is OFF, the user should not be able to see the  Upload Accounting Strings  icon. Hovering on the icon should show a tooltip saying  Upload Accounting Strings . Clicking on the  Upload Accounting Strings  icon should open a window where users can select and upload the bulk upload file. Upon Selecting the file, the system should validate the bulk upload file to verify all the data is valid. In case of valid data in the bulk upload file, the system should save the accounting strings uploaded via bulk upload in the DB. There should be a green noty message stating that the file has been uploaded successfully. They should start appearing in the accounting string table. If there are errors in the files, the system should generate an error report which the user can download. (refer to the ticket   ). There should a red noty message stating that the file has been failed to upload or there are errors in the file. There is one optional column  DELETE  in the bulk upload file. It is a flag type(true or false). The user can use it to delete the existing record in the system through bulk upload. The user can provide  X or any letter  in the column to mark the  DELETE  flag true. The accounting string with the  DELETE  flag true should be soft-deleted and kept in the DB. The system should keep it in the DB with the  DELETE  flag true if the user marks the  DELETE  flag true for the string that has never existed in the system before.  Please open the  Instructions  of the attached sheet to understand the validations of each field(column) present in the bulk upload file. The column names(fields) should be case-insensitive. The system should support custom labels for accounting and company objects in the bulk upload file as column(field) names.

issues.summary: AccVal: Admin: Admin can download the existing 1 million + accounting strings master data in CSV format
issues.description: Business Case: As an admin, I want to download more than 1 million accounting strings in Vroozi master data. Since Excel file has the limitation of not containing records of more than a million, the system should use the CSV format. Acceptance Criteria: There should be an  Export Accounting Strings  icon above the top right corner of the accounting string table on the Accounting String screen. ( The following image is just for reference. ) Hovering on the icon should show a tooltip saying  Export Accounting Strings . It should depend on a sub-feature toggle for UI CRUD operations(refer to  ). If the feature mentioned above toggle is ON, the user should be able to see the  Export Accounting Strings  icon. If the feature mentioned above toggle is OFF, the user should not be able to see the  Export Accounting Strings  icon. Clicking on the  Export Accounting Strings  icon should show an overlay if the accounting strings master data contains more than a million records. There should be an exclamation mark on the overlay. ( For reference, please see the mockup below for download In progress ) Under the exclamation mark, the overlay should state “The file you're about to download contains a significant amount of data, and it will be delivered in a CSV format. Would you like to proceed with the download?“. Under the text message, there should be two buttons. Continue Clicking on that should continue the export process. Cancel Clicking on that should abort the export process. When the user clicks on the  Continue  button, the system should show the following overlay that should disappear automatically: The In Progress spinner should appear around the  Export Accounting Strings  icon: Once the file is processed, The following overlay should appear that should disappear automatically: The  Export Accounting Strings  icon should turn green:  Clicking on the green  Export Accounting Strings  icon should download the accounting strings file in CSV format. The name of the downloaded file should be  Accounting-Strings-Export-{dateTimeStamp}.

issues.summary: LDAP injection ( smartOCI )
issues.description: The  stage_vsd  cookie appears to be vulnerable to LDAP injection attacks. The payloads  7xtginkvjw)(objectClass=*  and  hulq11daqk)(!(objectClass=*)  were each submitted in the stage_vsd cookie. These two requests resulted in different responses, indicating that the input may be being incorporated into a disjunctive LDAP query in an unsafe manner. Fix - If the cookie is compromised a unanimous error should be returned.

issues.summary: Vroozi API - Add support for Catalog API to store the edit options (Merge/Replace)
issues.description:
As an API user, we need to support he catalog update options in the Catalogs. Currently we will support two type of edit options. Acceptance Criteria: Catalog POST/PUT API should support  these two New edit options in the Catalog API CatalogUpdateTypeEnum editOption. Supported Values are: MERGE, REPLACE User should be able to store this value in the catalog User will perform any action on the catalog (items upload), it will be based on the stored value in this field. When edit option is stored as MERGE, and user is uploading a new file, this will keep existing items in the catalog, and add new items from the file. Any matching items will be updated from the file. When edit option is stored as REPLACE, and user will perform an action on the file, e.d upload the catalog items than only item provided in the catalog will be present in the catalog. User should get a validation error if the user is providing any other value in the POST/PUT call. {
    "id": "cf3e7cd5-ac2b-4e1b-8db2-4f8256b9433a",
    "status": "422",
    "title": "Unprocessable Entity",
    "errors": [
        {
            "code": "422",
            "element": "",
            "message": "Http message not readable, please check your input data.",
            "detail": "JSON parse error: Cannot deserialize value of type `com.vroozi.integration.v1.enums.CatalogUpdateTypeEnum` from String \"REPLACEEEEE\": value not one of declared Enum instance names: [MERGE, REPLACE]; nested exception is com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.exc.InvalidFormatException: Cannot deserialize value of type `com.vroozi.integration.v1.enums.CatalogUpdateTypeEnum` from String \"REPLACEEEEE\": value not one of declared Enum instance names: [MERGE, REPLACE]\n at [Source: (PushbackInputStream); line: 4, column: 19] (through reference chain: com.vroozi.integration.v1.model.CatalogModel[\"editOption\"])",
            "level": "Data Error"
        }
    ],
    "timestamp": "2024-01-24T10:57:42.398+0000"
} For already existing catalogs, when we get the catalog (single catalog or list of catalog) the editOptions field should map the stored value MERGE, REPLACE are supported values in GET APIs, for Catalogs in other status, we get null status. When catalog is updated from MERGE to REPLACE or vice versa and user is performing the action e.g APPROVE on catalog in working column, this will update catalog items based on the editOptions stored in the catalog. Public API documentation Update the documentation to expose the editOption field. Add following details to this field description editOption:
  type: "string"
  title: Edit option
  description: Edit option of the catalog.</br>
  In the context of the catalog API POST/PUT requests, only "MERGE" and "REPLACE" are accepted as valid values. While there may be additional values stored in existing catalogs, which will be exposed in the GET catalog APIs. It's important to note that these additional values are not supported when creating or updating catalogs through the API.
  example: "MERGE",
  default: MERGE
  enum:
    - MERGE
    - REPLACE Catalog CRUD operations.

Design and Develop the API to track the progress of the Async Status Update API
issues.description:
Develop an API to keep track of the Async status update API. When the action is performed e.g catalog moved from working to approved or approved to live column, it might take some time. To track the progress of this action, we need to expose the status api that will return the current status of the catalog. Acceptance Criteria: Update the response of the Action API to return a requestId to the user, that will be used to track of the status of this update request. Expose the GET end point, where requestId return to the user in the action API response GET /catalogs/request-tracking/{requestId} The response of the tracking API will look like { "requestId": "123-2123", "path" : "status-update", "asyncStatus": "Processing", "dateCreated": "2023-03-15T13:56:04.037+0000", "lastUpdated": "2023-03-15T13:56:04.037+0000", "errors" : [{ "code": "400", "element": "itemTieredPrice", "message" : "No matching mapping found for this field: [ITEM_TIERED_PRICE]", "detail" : "Download the error report from this link https://devqa8-admin.vroozi.com/adminui/view-error-report?catId=659fd24f724f391dac56b2d7", "level": "Data Error" } ], "metadata" : { "catalogId" : "", "version" : "2", "catalogName" : "", "externalId" : "", "catalogStatus" : "CATALOG status", "states": { "approvedItems" : 0, "pendingItems" : 10, "publishedItems" : 3, "rejectedItems" : 0, "totalItems" : 0, "outputRecordsCount" : 0, "failedRecordsCount" : 0, "inputRecordsCount" : 0 } } } If the requestId is not found, give validation error. { "id": "64ce4d74-7b9c-48d2-b356-cdb72ac17a64", "status": "404", "title": "Not Found", "errors": [ { "code": "404", "element": "requestId", "message": "Field [requestId] not found.", "detail": "Field [requestId] not found. Provided value: [53b80316-221b9-4f0b-a30f-d26ee79aed5b]", "level": "Data Error" } ], "timestamp": "2024-01-16T08:48:32.395+0000" } Update the public API documentation to include this API and its description. Use the following details summary: Get async request progress tracking By Request Id description: > Async request tracking By Request Id
tags: - Catalogs produces: - 'application/json' parameters: - name: 'requestId' in: 'path' required: true type: 'string' responses: 200: description: Async request. schema: $ref: '#/definitions/AsyncRequestModel' 401: description: Authorization failed. schema: $ref: '#/definitions/GenericErrorModel' 403: description: Invalid action. schema: $ref: '#/definitions/GenericErrorModel' 404: description: Async Request is not found. schema: $ref: '#/definitions/ErrorDataModel' 500: description: Something went wrong. Actual error message will be available in the response body schema: $ref: '#/definitions/ErrorDataModel' security: - ${aws.apigateway.authorizer.name}: [ ] - api_key: [ ] x-amazon-apigateway-request-validator: 'Validate query string parameters and headers' x-amazon-apigateway-integration: responses: default: statusCode: '200' requestParameters: $ref: '../../common/get-by-request-id-param-mapping.yml' uri: 'http://${stageVariables.catalogNodeServerHost}/catalog/api/integration/v1/catalogs/request-tracking/{requestId}' passthroughBehavior: 'when_no_match' connectionType: 'VPC_LINK' connectionId: '${aws.apigateway.vpc.link.id}' httpMethod: 'GET' type: 'http_proxy' type: "object" title: Async Request tracking Response. description: > A representation of tracking progress of async requests. properties: id: type: "string" title: ID description: > System generated unique identifier for this object (Read only). default: "" example: "5a3bd758e61c824a33ded63a" requestId: type: "string" title: Request Id description: System generated id to uniquely identify catalog status update request example: "123-2123" path: type: "string" title: Path of the async API related to this tracking request description: Path of the async API related to this tracking request. example: "status-update" asyncStatus: type: "string" title: Status description: Status of Async Request example: "IN_PROGRESS" enum: - IN_PROGRESS - ERROR - COMPLETED metadata: $ref: './metadata.yml' errors: type: "array" items: $ref: '../common/error-model.yml' dateCreated: type: "string" title: Date Created description: > Creation date of the object (Read only).
Date will be output in format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ format: "date-time" example: "2023-03-15T13:56:04.037+0000" lastUpdated: type: "string" title: Last Updated description: > Last updated date of the object (Read only).
Date will be output in format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ format: "date-time" example: "2023-04-05T13:56:04.037+0000" type: "object" title: Catalog Item States description: A representation of Catalog item states properties: approvedItemsCount: type: "integer" title: Approved Items Count description: Number of items which are approved by the approver (Read only). example: 100 rejectedItemsCount: type: "integer" title: Rejected Items Count description: Number of items which are rejected by the approver (Read only). example: 10 pendingItemsCount: type: "integer" title: Pending Items Count description: Number of items which are pending approval (Read only). example: 237 totalItems: type: "integer" title: Total number of item's in the catalog description: Total number of item in the catalog (Read only). example: 505 publishedItemsCount: type: "integer" title: Published Items Count description: Number of items which are published (Read only). example: 505 inputRecordsCount: type: "integer" title: Input Records Count description: Number of records parsed from uploaded request payload (Read only). example: 850 outputRecordsCount: type: "integer" title: Output Records Count description: Number of records successfully saved in database (Read only). example: 200 failedRecordsCount: type: "integer" title: Failed Records Count description: Number of records that couldn’t be saved (Read only). example: 55 type: "object" title: Metadata description: A representation of Catalog metadata properties: catalogId: type: "string" title: ID description: > System generated unique identifier for this object (Read only). default: "" example: "5a3bd758e61c824a33ded63a" externalId: type: "string" title: External ID description: > Unique identifier for this object in external system. issues.summary: AccVal: Admin: Admin cannot activate the accounting string that contains inactive accounting objects.
issues.description: Business Case: As an admin, I cannot activate an accounting string that contains the inactive accounting or organization object. Acceptance Criteria: The accounting string was deactivated due to having an inactive accounting/organization object in it. The admin should not be able to reactivate it. Accounting Strings Table: When an admin selects such accounting string(s) and clicks the  Activate  button, the system should show a red NOTY message. The message should be “The accounting strings(s) which contain inactive/deleted  ( Updated on    )accounting/organization objects cannot be activated.“. The message should be a slider. It should disappear after 3 seconds. When an admin selects multiple accounting strings that contain accounting string(s) having inactivated accounting objects and clicks the  Activate  button, the system should show a red NOTY message. The message should be “The accounting strings(s) which contain inactive/deleted accounting/organization objects cannot be activated.”. ( Updated on    ) The message should be a slider. It should disappear after 3 seconds. Accounting String Modal: When the admin accesses the Accounting String modal of a deactivated string( due to inactive accounting/organization objects ), the  Status  field should become read-only with an  Inactive  value.  There should be a message beneath the  Status  field. The message should be “This accounting string contains inactive/deleted accounting/organization objects that cannot be activated.“. ( Updated on    ) The message should disappear once the user changes the inactive/deleted accounting/organization object(s). The  Status  field should be enabled again.

issues.summary: AccVal: Admin: Admin can Activate/Deactivate accounting strings from the Edit Accounting String modal.
issues.description: Business Case: As an admin, I want to activate/deactivate the accounting strings from the Edit Accounting String modal as needed. Acceptance Criteria: There should be a new drop-down field on the Edit Accounting String modal. The drop-down field name should be ‘ Status ’. This field should be in the General Information section. This field should be beneath the  Valid To  field. The default selected value should be  Active . The other value should be  Inactive , which the user should be able to select in certain use cases. Duration is not given: If the duration( Valid From, Valid To ) is not given, the user should be able to select the status of the accounting string as needed. Duration is given but Within the Range: If the duration( Valid From, Valid To ) is given, and the current date falls into that, the user should be able to select the status of the accounting string as needed. Duration is given but Out of Range: If the duration( Valid From, Valid To ) is given, and the current date does not fall into that( duration should be in the past dates or the future ), the user should not be able to select the status of the accounting string. The  Status  field should become read-only. The system should automatically compute the status as  Inactive  based on the given duration. The Status field should display the selected value  Inactive . There should be a text message beneath the  Status  field. The message should be “*The status cannot be changed as the current date does not fall in the given duration*.“ Such accounting strings should be activated via the CRON job( existing implementation ). Once the accounting string is activated via the CRON job, the user can manually change the status of the accounting string until the current date falls into the duration( existing implementation ). epic.summary: Vroozi Accounting Validation 2024: GA Support Release:Accounting Validation in PR Budget Workflow
epic.description: Vroozi Accounting Validation GA Phase#4 is post MVP phase(refer to  ) where it will become generally available for all the subscribed customers. In this phase, we will cover the following areas: Accounting Validation in Budget Workflow

issues.summary: AccVal: Purchase: The system should run the validation at CR load in Budget Workflow.
issues.description: Business Case: The system should run the accounting string validations at CR load if an invalid accounting string(s) already exists in the document. Acceptance Criteria: The system should run the accounting string validations when the user accesses(loads) the CR having invalid accounting string(s) associated with its line item(s) in the Budget workflow. The CR can be accessed through all the possible avenues in the system. The user refreshes the document. The user should be able to take action on the document(i.e. Budget Approvers) If a user doesn’t act on CR when it is in Budget Workflow, the system should not run the accounting validation on the document load. (e.g. requester accesses the CR in budget workflow) The following scenarios have already been handled in the ticket   : Admin (in  Draft  and  Rejected  state) Requester (in  Draft  and  Rejected  state) Sourcing Approver (in  Sourcing Review  state) Financial Approver (in  Financial Review  state) The validation should be run for the following: Every Line item of the CR has an invalid accounting string. Every split of each line item of the CR has an invalid accounting string. The system should run the validation according to the logic defined in  . The system should display an overlay when the system opens the CR document. The overlay should grey out(silkscreen) the CR screen in the background. The silkscreen should block the user from performing any action in the application.  There should be an In Progress icon on the overlay( not the exclamation icon as shown in. the mockup ) The main text should be  Accounting Validation(s) in progress . The sub-text should be  This may take few seconds. The following highlighted points in red are not required. Clicking  Cancel Button should: (In this scenario, the Cancel button is not required. It should not be visible) Disappear the Overlay. Abort the validation process. The user should be able to work on the CR document. The system should show the  Accounting Validation in Progress  overlay with a silkscreen on the CR document if the user navigates away from the CR document during the accounting validation due to any reason and comes back to the CR document while the accounting validation is still in progress.  Once the accounting validation process is complete: If the system finds all the accounting strings valid: The text on the overlay should be updated. There should be a green tick icon on the overlay( not the exclamation icon as shown in the mockup ) The main text should be  Accounting Validation(s) completed . After 3 seconds, the overlay should disappear( The standard noty interval ). The user should be able to perform their activities on the CR document. If the system finds any accounting string associated with the line items invalid during the validation process, then after the validation process completion: The text on the overlay should be updated. There should be an exclamation icon on the overlay The main text should be  Accounting Validation(s) completed . The sub-text should be  One or more accounting strings are invalid. Clicking the  Close  Button should disappear the overlay. The user should be able to work on the CR document. The  Submit  button should be disabled. The Submit button should be enabled once the user updates the accounting combinations on the line items that were invalidated by the system. Account String Warning Messages: In case invalid accounting strings are identified, the system should show the accounting string warning message(s) as already implemented in   for the CR document.

issues.summary: AccVal: Purchase: The budget approver should be able to see the error message and highlighted line items on the CR that were invalidated by the accounting validation process.
issues.description: Business Case: As a Budget approver, I want to see the error message and red highlighted line item that the system marked erroneous due to invalid associated accounting strings. Acceptance Criteria: After the closing of the Accounting Validation overlay stating that there are invalid accounting strings associated(refer to  ): The system should show the error message above the CR line item grid. There should be a separate error message for each invalid accounting string. The following is the pattern of the error message that should be followed: Accounting String Error - Line Item #…  → Display all line items containing that Accounting String The following Accounting String has been deactivated  → Error Code 02 The following Accounting String has been deleted  → No error code exists yet The following Accounting String is not valid (does not exist)  → Error Code 01 Company Code = <Code> - <Description> Plant Code = <Code> - <Description> Cost Center / WBS Element / Internal Order = <Code> - <Description> GL Account = <Code> - <Description> … (display the rest of the elements in the same orderasf the line items in separate lines) The message should read “Accounting String Error - Line item # (comma separated).“. After the message should tell the user why the selected accounting string combination of the mentioned line items was marked invalid. Either the string was deactivated. Or the string does not exist in Vroozi Master Data. Then the message should display the associated accounting combination with the mentioned line items in the strings Please review the following mockup: After these errors, if any other error appears due to adding a new line item or editing the existing line item, those errors will be visible under the accounting string errors.  Below AC highlighted in red is not required at this time.  2023-07-24   The system should highlight the line items which have invalid accounting strings associated with them. ERROR MESSAGE ABOVE THE LINE ITEM GRID: There should be a red error message above the line item grid of the CR if the system determines that there are invalid accounting strings associated with the line items of the CR. The error message should be  There are invalid accounting string(s) associated with one or more line items. Please review the red highlighted line item(s). The red error message should appear when: The financial approver closes the Accounting Validation overlay mentioning the invalid accounting strings associated with the line items. When the financial approver moves away from the CR when the validation process is in progress and navigates back to the CR document after the validation process has been completed and invalid accountings were found. This red error message should disappear once the financial approver resolves(if they have the editing rights) all the accounting validation errors. The red error message should appear for the financial approver in both Edit and Read Only modes. This red error message should be visible to all users who can take action in that particular state of the CR document. The error message should appear to the Financial approvers in Staircase as well. ERRONEOUS LINE ITEM HIGHLIGHT: All the line items having accounting validation errors should be highlighted in red. The erroneous line items should have the info icon next to the line item description. The exclamation icon color should be red. Hovering on the exclamation icon should show a tooltip message. The message should be  Invalid accounting string(s) is associated with this line item. The red highlight and exclamation icon should appear when: The financial approver closes the Accounting Validation overlay mentioning the invalid accounting strings associated with the line items. When the financial approver moves away from the CR when the validation process is in progress and navigates back to the CR document after the validation process has been completed and invalid accountings were found. This red highlight and exclamation icon should disappear once the financial approver (if they have the editing rights)updates the accounting combination on the line item that was invalidated by the system. The red highlight and exclamation icon should appear in both Edit and Read Only modes for the sourcing approver. This red highlight and exclamation icon should be visible to all users who can take action in that particular state of the CR document.

issues.summary: AccVal: Purchase: The system should run the validation at CR Budget approval.
issues.description: Business Case: The system should run the accounting string validations at CR Budget approval. Acceptance Criteria: The system should run the accounting string validations when the budget approver approves the CR. The validation should be run for the following: Every Line item of the CR Every split of each line item of the CR The system should run the validation according to the logic defined in  . The system should display an overlay when the budget approver clicks the CR  Approve  button. The overlay should grey out(silkscreen) the CR screen in the background. The silkscreen should block the user from performing any action in the application. There should be an In Progress icon on the overlay( not the exclamation icon as shown in. the mockup ) The main text should be  Accounting Validation(s) in progress . The sub-text should be  This may take few seconds. Clicking the  Cancel  Button should: Disappear the Overlay. Abort the validation process. The user should be able to work on the CR document. The system should show the  Accounting Validation in Progress  overlay with a silkscreen on the CR document if the budget approver navigates away from the PR document during the accounting validation due to any reason and returns to the CR document while the accounting validation is still in progress.  The system should show the  Accounting Validation in Progress  overlay with a silkscreen on the CR document if other budget approvers associated with the PR open it during the validation process.  Once the accounting validation process is complete: If the system finds all the accounting strings valid: The text on the overlay should be updated. There should be a green tick icon on the overlay( not the exclamation icon as shown in the mockup ) The main text should be  Accounting Validation(s) completed . After 3 seconds, the overlay should disappear. The CR should be approved successfully and moved into the next state. The user should be navigated to the  Approve Request  page( existing functionality ) If the system finds any accounting string associated with the line items invalid during the validation process, then after the validation process completion: The text on the overlay should be updated. There should be an exclamation icon on the overlay The main text should be  Accounting Validation(s) completed . The sub-text should be  One or more accounting strings are invalid. Clicking the  Close  Button should disappear the overlay. The user should be able to work on the CR document. The  Approve  Button should be disabled for the budget approver. The budget approver should only be able to reject the CR. The system should send the CR back to the requester upon rejection. The requester should be able to see the red error message above the line item grid and highlighted line items having invalid accounting strings. The requester should be able to edit the line items on the Rejected CR( Existing implementation ). Please note that the existing budget functionality should not impact by this accounting validation that is: The system should reject the complete PR if one of the budget approvers rejects the CR. The system should save approval if one of the budget approvers approves the CR while the system is waiting for the other budget approvals. The system should show a slider message that the CR has already been rejected if one of the budget approvers has rejected the PR already when other budget approvers are also reviewing the same CR and also rejecting it.
